reviewText: I remember seeing this movie long ago and it really stuck in my mind.  I just ordered the DVD and can't wait to see it (again)!
Got this for my husband and he absolutely loves this movie.  I even watched it several times and I like it too.
Delivered as promised and in excellent condition.  I wish that this movie was available in DVD.

I saw this movie a long time ago on HBO and remembered it as being a good movie and very interesting. I took it out the other day and put it in and watched it again. I must say that it seems dated now. I would like to see them remake Barry Seals story now. Hopper is ok but he pretty much is 'Dennis Hopper' with a fake accent. The movie is still good and informative but it just seems like and early 80's movie. The characters are kind of cartoonish and the acting is kind of second rate and that takes away from the realism.

It starred the great actor Dennis Hopper as Berry Seal, a DEA informant. He was hoping to get no time in jail if he helped the government in their pathetic "war on drugs" (liberals and conservatives can agree it's been a complete failure). Hopper's portrayal of Seal gives me the impression that the informant was a brash adventurer who smuggled drugs just as much for the thrill as for the money. When caught, he didn't turn on his partners in crime but did help get evidence about the drug smugglers in South America. He did risk his life and he should have got what the government promised. What he got was doubled-crossed.

Seal was far from an upstanding citizen but his treatment by our government is reprehensible.

I am friends with the characters(Barry and Camp) kids.  This movie is such a great piece of art on just how the Columbian drug lords work and how corrupt the government is.  This true story is touching, it is about a man who brought down the South American drug cartel single handedly, and was double crossed by a judge in Baton Rouge, Louisiana and Oliver North after he completed his task given to him by our government.  It is a 11 out of 10.  A NEED TO SEE MOVIE!!

Dennis Hopper, is a true living legend. This singular and talented actor that so many good performances has done, it shines with this clever script as a casting agent' s dream come true as drug smuggler.  Interesting and well effective.
Above the average.
I saw this movie on HBO and loved it-- It played on all your emotions- humor, action, sadness.  Really enjoyed it and highly recommed it!

Based on a true story,Barry Seal was the man who brought down the druglords in South America. He also paid for it with his life,at the hands of the US Government. You really want to see how the Gov does business?  Check it out!

I see it for sale here at a VERY high cost for VHS. Sadly .... this movie is about the cartel that involved the Rodhams & Clintons in ARK. Based on a true story .... many do not know this .... I REALLY want a copy but just a bit too costly & would prefer on DVD
This is an excellent movie, sure wish I could find it on DVD,  saw it more than 10 yrs ago and have been searching for it since

Terrific HBO movie about Barry Seal that deserves to be on DVD. Much better than most of the drug running movies I've seen. Excellent script, direction, music, and one of Dennis Hopper's best performances. Wake up, HBO! This film merits DVD distribution.
Not the greatest quality of clearnest

I haven't seen it, but I was in it.

I was an extra in the casino, and beach scenes.  They were both shot in Puerto Rico at an Isla Verde location.
would like to buy another new one, I really like the movie--Dennis Hopper does on of his best acting jobs--the role fits him perfectly!

Barry had more going on than the gov't ever knew about except after the fact. This story is true as far as it goes and the Federal Magistrate in Baton Rouge did allow Barry to be murdered. Dennis Hopper did a very brave thing by making this movie. He followed the facts and did not have to embellish. He did have to condense a bit but he hit the right events to make a very good and accurate film.

Double Crossed, 1991 film

This is based on a true story. In 1979 a small two-engine airplane flies low over the gulf coast (to avoid radar). A package drops into a river where an air-boat retrieves it. A helicopter flies over this boat and retrieves the package, then drops it on land. A van drives by to pick it up, only to throw it off a bridge where it is picked up by waiting men. Military soldiers arrest Barry Seal at a foreign airport and put him in jail. Seal meets another pilot from Louisiana and gets information from him. Back in Baton Rouge he talks to his wife Debbie. Next he is in Miami talking about a flying job for $3,000 a trip (this is 1977). Seal's cover job is buying and selling airplanes in foreign countries. The Louisiana State Police follow him. In 1983 he lands in Fort Lauderdale Miami and is arrested by the DEA. Somebody squealed, he is facing 60 years in prison. Can he get help? Only if he turns informant.

Seal goes to Washington for help at the "Drug Task Force" to make a deal. He goes to Miami to meet Donaldson. There is conflict with the DEA agents over Seal's knowledge. He wants a lot and will give a lot. At a lounge Seal meets Lido and gets a job for tonight. He lands near Medellin Columbia. The numbers on his airplane are changed. The pilot and co-pilot meet a very rich man and his partners. This rich man blames the CIA for a political assassination. Their drug operation must be moved to Nicaragua, they work with the Sandinistas. They will need a big airplane to transport fifteen tons of drugs. Seal talks to Donaldson from a public telephone. Back in the USA seal is in court to be sentenced to ten years. Where is the DEA? Seal thought about his past actions and repents. The DEA agents just do their job. Seal flies to Columbia to pick up a heavy load. The plane crashes on take-off! It is quickly unloaded before it burns and explodes.

There is a replacement plane. They land in Nicaragua. The CIA wants pictures of Nicaraguan officials with the drug load. They promise to intercede with Seal's judge. Bundles are loaded into Seal's big airplane. The pictures are sent to Washington DC. Ollie North wants these pictures released to the public. A US General talks about drugs from Nicaragua! Seal wants to make another run to get information. [Believable?] No co-pilot this trip. The DEA agents await his return. "All is well" says the radio. Seal returns home. His wife is worried, Seal tells her the truth about his job, but she doesn't believe him! Newspapers print the story about a drug informant. Was Seal double-crossed? The drug dealers put out a reward on Seal, dead or alive. Seal continues to work undercover in Las Vegas. A foreign premier was convicted. The judge reduces Seal's sentence to time served due to his work as an informant.

But in Louisiana the judge sentences Seal to stay at a public place. Another double-cross to allow his assassination? The IRS shows up at his home to collect $29 million in back taxes! The DEA was told to stay away from court. "Open season"? Dave brings more bad news about the death of his co-pilot. "He flew into a mountain." [Sabotage?] A small boat crosses a river at night. Later his man gets into a white car. He uses a machine gun on Seal. [Termination with extreme prejudice?] "Nobody from the DEA is allowed at the funeral." [To avoid identification of undercover agents.] President Reagan denounces the Nicaraguan regime for drug smuggling! [But we know what really happened. Attorney-General Meese was a good friend of Reagan since he was Governor. After unlaundered drug money was found in Meese's personal checking account he had to resign. This was blamed on Barry Seal.] Read "Compromised" by Terry K. Reed for the details of drug smuggling by the Reagan administration.
I have been looking for weeks for this movie, I was said it was on VHS, however, I was just happy to find it.  Quick Shipping
